answers.answer: I have this exact same thing!  For about a year.  Just on the left side.  Feels like my ear and down the left side of my head.  Can't pinpoint a time of day or something that triggers it.  Appears random.  Usually when I'm relaxing (reading, on the computer etc) but I think that's just when I'm able to lie still and feel it/think about it.  Not painful.  Usually putting  a finger on the area and pressing lightly will take the weird feeling down a notch.  What is this?

HI,How are you? Tingling sensation or paresthesia could be due to a sensory nerve being damaged or injured. Other causes may include conditions such as diabetes, ear infection or  peripheral neuropathy. It would be best to have this evaluated by your doctor for proper management. Complete medical history, physical examination and laboratory tests may be done to help with the diagnosis. Take care and keep us posted.
I have a tingling sensation behind my ear that travels down my neck could it be caused by herniated discs at c4-5, c5-6, c6-7?

question: Approximately 1 to 2 weeks ago I began having this tingling sensation on the left side of my head.  It occurs occationally throughout the day and evening.  The tingling is from the top left side of my head down to just below my ear lobe.  My left ear also has the tingling.  Nothing on my right side, only on the left side.  What could this be - I am concerned?
title: Tingling Sensation
